title: Identity Review | Tovino Thomas Starrer Is Expensive, Expansive and Excessively Complicated - Lensmen Reviews
summary:
Identity Review | Expensive, Expansive and Excessively Complicated

Publication Date: January 2, 2025 | Source: Lensmen Reviews

The review discusses the latest film 'Identity', highlighting both its ambitious scope and intricate plot that tends to overcomplicate a seemingly simple story.

  • The story revolves around Haran Shankar, a character with an abusive past and unique skills as a sketch artist.
  • As Haran interacts with his police officer neighbor and a witness with face blindness, the narrative unfolds in unexpected ways.
  • The film is noted for its detailed research but suffers from excessive exposition that diminishes the impact of plot twists.
  • Director’s choices in cinematography and pacing received praise, especially during action sequences.
  • The review suggests that the film's ambitions could have benefited from a more refined screenplay.
“A bit more refinement on a writing level would have made Identity a quality film by all means.”

In conclusion, while 'Identity' showcases ambitious filmmaking and intriguing concepts, its overly complicated storyline ultimately detracts from the viewer's experience.
newTitle: Identity Review: Ambitious Yet Overcomplicated

title: These two CBFC objections for Game Changer raise questions - 123telugu
summary:
These two CBFC objections for Game Changer raise questions

Published on: Jan 2, 2025 Source: 123telugu.com

The grand arrival of Game Changer, a highly anticipated political drama directed by Shankar Shanmugam, is just around the corner, set to release on January 10, 2025.

  • The movie has been granted a U/A certificate by the CBFC with a runtime of 2 hours and 45 minutes.
  • CBFC objections include the requirement for the movie's title to be presented in Telugu and the exclusion of the honorific 'Padmasree' before Brahmanandam's name.
  • The concerns prompt questions about inconsistencies with previous films like Prabhas’ Kalki 2898 AD.
  • The objections may relate to past controversies surrounding the misuse of award titles by actors, including a directive from the Andhra Pradesh High Court.
“It remains to be seen who will provide clarity on these matters.”

As the film's release approaches, the clarity regarding these objections is eagerly awaited by audiences.
newTitle: CBFC Objections on Game Changer Raise Questions

title: Boney Kapoor says Allu Arjun was 'unnecessarily dragged' into Pushpa 2 stampede case: 'It was only because of the crowd' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Boney Kapoor has said that it was wrong to drag Allu Arjun in the Sandhya Theatre stampede case, adding that the death of the fan happened due to the crowd.

Date: Jan 02, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Boney Kapoor defended Telugu star Allu Arjun concerning his legal troubles following a tragic stampede that resulted in a fan's death at the premiere of Pushpa 2: The Rule.

  • Boney Kapoor criticized the allegations against Allu Arjun, asserting they were unfounded.
  • He emphasized that the tragedy was due to the overwhelming crowd and not Arjun's actions.
  • On December 4, prior to the film’s release, the stampede led to the death of a 35-year-old woman.
  • Allu Arjun was arrested on charges of culpable homicide but was granted bail the following day.
  • Pushpa 2: The Rule has grossed ₹1760 crore globally, becoming a major box office success.
“It was only because of the crowd that had gathered to see the film.” - Boney Kapoor

This incident highlights the dangers of massive fan gatherings and the responsibilities of celebrities in such situations. The ongoing investigation will determine the future implications for Allu Arjun and the cinema industry.
newTitle: Boney Kapoor Supports Allu Arjun Amidst Stampede Controversy

title: Shah Rukh Khan Says 'Don't Stop My Revenue' To Soft Drink Endorsement: 'If It's Poisoning People...' | Vira - News18
summary:
Shah Rukh Khan Says 'Don't Stop My Revenue' To Soft Drink Endorsement: 'If It's Poisoning People...'

Date: January 02, 2025 Source: Vira

Shah Rukh Khan recently revisited the controversy surrounding his endorsements of soft drinks, questioning societal logic in targeting celebrities while allowing dangerous products to remain on the market.

  • Khan argued that if soft drinks are genuinely harmful, they should be banned rather than targeting endorsers.
  • He emphasized the hypocrisy of allowing harmful products that generate government revenue.
  • Khan discussed the portrayal of smoking in cinema, urging focus on larger health issues instead.
  • He is set to appear next in Sujoy Ghosh's upcoming film 'King' alongside his daughter, Suhana Khan.
“You’re not stopping certain products if you think they’re harmful, but they’re revenue to the government. Don’t stop my revenue.”

Khan's statements underline the ongoing debate about celebrity endorsements and public health, advocating for transparency and accountability in product regulation.
newTitle: Shah Rukh Khan Addresses Soft Drink Endorsement Controversy

title: Pushpa 2 worldwide box office collection day 28: Allu Arjun-starrer becomes the second-biggest Indian grosser of all time, beats Baahubali 2’s Rs 1788 cr record - The Indian Express
summary:
Pushpa 2 worldwide box office collection day 28

Date & Source: Published on New Year’s day by Indian Express

The Allu Arjun-starrer Pushpa 2 has crossed the ₹1788 crore worldwide benchmark, surpassing SS Rajamouli’s Baahubali 2, and is now the second-highest Indian grosser.

  • As of January 1, Pushpa 2 collected ₹13.15 crore at the domestic box office.
  • The film’s nett domestic collection stands at ₹1184.65 crore.
  • The Hindi version contributed ₹774.65 crore to the collection.
  • Internationally, Pushpa 2 has a solid run ahead until competitors release in mid-January.
“So far, Aamir Khan’s Dangal is the biggest grosser in the history of Indian cinema at ₹2070 crore.”

Pushpa 2's significant box office success highlights its impact in Indian cinema, especially in comparison to previous record-holders.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 Becomes the Second-Biggest Indian Grosser of All Time

Pushpa 2 box office Day 28: Allu Arjun film welcomes 2025 in style - India Today
summary:
Pushpa 2 Box Office Collection Day 28: Allu Arjun's Film Welcomes 2025 in Style

Published On: Jan 2, 2025

Source: India Today

Allu Arjun's Pushpa 2: The Rule welcomed 2025 in style, with a significant increase in box office collection on January 1.

  • The film earned ₹1,184 crore nett in India over 28 days.
  • On January 1, it saw a 70% increase in collection, earning ₹13.15 crore nett on that day.
  • The Hindi version generated ₹9.5 crore nett, while the Telugu version earned ₹3.15 crore nett.
  • The total earnings include ₹774.65 crore nett from the Hindi version and ₹330.53 crore from the Telugu version.
  • Pushpa 2 aims for a ₹2,000-crore gross worldwide milestone.
“Pushpa 2 is still continuing its dream run in theatres, especially in the Hindi belt.”

The film, directed by Sukumar, features Allu Arjun alongside Rashmika Mandanna and Fahadh Faasil. It has been a record-breaking success globally.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 Box Office Collection Hits ₹1,184 Crore on Day 28

title: 'It Ends With Us' director Justin Baldoni files $250 MILLION lawsuit against The New York Times for libel - The Times of India
summary:
Justin Baldoni Files $250 Million Lawsuit Against The New York Times Over Blake Lively Claims

Published on: New Year's Eve, Source: Times of India

The lawsuit centers around allegations of libel and false light invasion of privacy following an article that claimed false narratives about Baldoni and actress Blake Lively.

  • Justin Baldoni has filed a $250 million lawsuit against The New York Times.
  • The lawsuit is supported by co-plaintiffs including publicists and producers.
  • Baldoni accuses the Times of publishing defamatory claims based on allegations made by Lively.
  • He claims the newspaper distorted communications and relied heavily on Lively's unverified narrative.
  • In a counter-response, Blake Lively has filed a federal lawsuit against Baldoni, alleging harassment and a retaliatory scheme.
  • The romantic drama 'It Ends With Us' premiered amid ongoing tensions between Baldoni and Lively.
  • The New York Times stated they will vigorously defend against the lawsuit.
“The role of an independent news organization is to follow the facts where they lead. Our story was meticulously and responsibly reported.” - New York Times spokesperson

This legal battle highlights the increasing tensions in Hollywood and questions surrounding public narratives and reputations.
newTitle: Justin Baldoni Files $250 Million Lawsuit Against The New York Times Over Blake Lively Claims
